channel.title: [PI]Update Server Without Having to Restart
channel.description: Okay, I've gotten the tutorial to work a long time ago on my Delta source, but I can't seem to get it to work right on PI. When I compile, it says reloading class blah blah, and then after a while it DCs the server. I put the rebel.xml in the folder that contains every folder, like source>src>server, the folder would be source. XML file: [code=xml]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <application xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://www.zeroturnaround.com" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.zeroturnaround.com/alderaan/rebel-2_0.xsd"> <classpath fallback="default"> <dir name="/home/brandon/Desktop/Server Stuff/SageScape2"> </dir> </classpath> </application> [/code] My run: [code]#!/bin/sh cd "/home/brandon/Desktop/Server Stuff/SageScape2" java -Xmx800m -classpath bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar -noverify -javaagent:/home/brandon/ZeroTurnaround/JRebel/jrebel.jar server.Server && javaerrorlog[/code] Any help please? I purchased a license a while ago, and I could share it, if someone could help. I even tried putting the xml file in every folder in the bin the contained a .class file.

item.title: [PI]Update Server Without Having to Restart
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Okay, I’ve gotten the tutorial to work a long time ago on my Delta source, but I can’t seem to get it to work right on PI. When I compile, it says reloading class blah blah, and then after a while it DCs the server. I put the rebel.xml in the folder that contains every folder, like source>src>server, the folder would be source. XML file: [code=xml]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>

[/code] My run: [code]#!/bin/sh cd "/home/brandon/Desktop/Server Stuff/SageScape2" java -Xmx800m -classpath bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar -noverify -javaagent:/home/brandon/ZeroTurnaround/JRebel/jrebel.jar server.Server && javaerrorlog[/code] Any help please? I purchased a license a while ago, and I could share it, if someone could help. I even tried putting the xml file in every folder in the bin the contained a .class file.
